Posts.EditableText:
This one is called, Find The Cause of Run Time Error 9 !!

Ok, seriously, I had been working mildly hard on a mob spawning system and had it working completely perfect. So I went back to add a few bells and whistles(telling the player the mob has arrived in the room and something else), I add them, save, restart the server and "Run Time Error 9 Sub Script Out Of Range" I've tried converting things back to the original and no luck, and also removing the entire section of code that was added(the spawning system) which still resulted in the same error.

I'd appreciated it if alex or anyone else could figure out the source of this as I'm stumped. I'll walk away from it for a while and come back, feel free to download the file and help out or just to look at and steal my precious QuestNet style.

file -> removed

Posts.EditableText: man, thats screwed up.  ive deleted procedures, startscripts, commands, and it still does it!
Posts.HTML: man, thats screwed up.  ive deleted procedures, startscripts, commands, and it still does it!

Posts.EditableText: edit: problem fixed. It seems Quest will no longer allow objects to have an "alias" property within the "properties" tag and will result in the subscript out of range error. now you must use the alias <#object-alias#> tag apparently.
Posts.HTML: edit: problem fixed. It seems Quest will no longer allow objects to have an "alias" property within the "properties" tag and will result in the subscript out of range error. now you must use the alias <#object-alias#> tag apparently.

Posts.EditableText: That shouldn't be happening. If you can send me some example code I can fix the problem. Are you using any libraries?
